content.description: A couple big moves lead you to an easy top out. Sit Start using the three finger pocket and the sidepull directly below it. Commit to the pocket out left and then work your way straight up in line with right hand. A few key foot placements and hand adjustments aid in this routes completion. See video in comments for complete beta.
content.location: Just left of Air It Out.

content.description: Start on the corner and then go up and left on good holds. Top out.
content.location: Start on the corner and then move out left on the boulder. (Not shown in picture)

content.description: Small, sharp holds. on a leaning ledge. As you move up the holds get bigger.
content.location: Start in the low right corner and move up to the low part of the boulder.

content.description: Utilize the same sit start as for Weiner in the Window and make the first big move out to the pocket. From here continue working left, staying low on the overhung face avoiding the jug rail just above. Continue working left until you reach the last big pocket on the overhung face and work up and left to top out with easier moves. See video in comments for complete beta.
content.location: Same start as Weiner in the Window but work left instead of straight up.

content.description: Boulder 4 from the area pictures provided by Gary Mattos. This is a fun boulder with sharp rock. Start with hands down low on either side of the block and then start bumping, hooking, and tossing to the obvious horn and top out.
content.location: Walk up the Tram Trail and go left at the first left onto the Rock Island Trail (16B on the sign). This boulder is on the right side of the trail and is one of two boulders that pinch the trail at a short set of rock steps.

content.description: A variant to Warm-Up Problem.  This adds a sit start and goes right halfway up while I think Warm-Up goes left.  Once you get over the bulge stay right to make the problem harder.  Going left makes it V0.
content.location: Sit start in the lower left corner with your right hand on the lower sidepull and your left hand in on the second sidepull above.

content.description: Good crimps and sidepulls lead you across the rock to a large crack.  Climb up the crack to the left on slopers and crimps to top out right below the peak.
content.location:
Sit start in the lower left corner with your right hand on the lower sidepull and your left hand in a three finger pocket.

goo.gl/maps/61LFCoiqsQYLXT1g6

content.description: Right foot starts on bottom right outcropping, left hand in a good 2-3 finger pocket, right hand on a jug. Work your way up, traversing left, reach for upper slopy hold on right.
content.location: On same boulder as 96F, to the right of that route.

content.description: Start on left hand side-pull and right hand slopy crimp off to the right side. Move up, staying below the clear crack, and then left. Top out just right of tree.
content.location: Take #14 Tram Trail from Warm Springs Golf Course, left on #16B Rock Island Trail, go past the first switchback in the Trail and the rock is on the left at the next corner of the same trail.

content.description: Overhanging face climbing on huge holds leads to a mantle topout on smaller but still easy holds.
content.location: Big positive rail just to the right of Erectile Dysfunction.

content.description:
Short, overhanging offwidth leads to fist jams and then wide hands.

Good clean stone in the crack, still a bit dirty on the topout. I brushed it some, but it will take some time to clean up.
content.location: Starts literally on Erectile Dysfunction. Sit start and head up the crack.

content.description: Use slippery slopers, cruxy crimps, fancy footwork, and mad mantle skills to tackle this monster! Viagra is aid.
content.location:
Best way to get there is to follow tram trail #14 from the Warm Springs golf course parking lot to #16 table rock loop once it's on your left. If you get to #16a Rock Garden, you've gone too far.

Google maps link:

google.com/maps/place/43%C2…

'27.7%22N+116%C2%B009'10.7%22W/@43.591036,-116.1535162,211m/data=!3m2!1e3!4b1!4m6!3m5!1s0x0:0x0!7e2!8m2!3d43.5910352!4d-116.152969

content.description: Good holds down low lead to bigger moves as you get higher.  Get some air while you reach for the right side of the prow and work your way to the top.
content.location:
Sit start in the lower left corner with your right hand on the lower sidepull and your left hand in a three finger pocket.

goo.gl/maps/61LFCoiqsQYLXT1g6

content.description: Start with foot or feet on the small ledge just off the ground, with hands on either side on decent sized sidecrimps. Then move up to small pockets and large rounded jug. Continue to the two opposing cracks on the upper face and top out.
content.location:
43.591909, -116.161798

Hike up #14 tram trail, after 2-3 minutes you'll see a prominent rounded boulder on a hilltop to the left.
